page.title: 17FARMING CHANGES SINCE 1953
page.content: Mr Richardson,the farmer at{Keybridge {Farm}has been there since 1953.When he bought the farm a lot of people{owned their own farms but through the years the Scottish Amicable Insurance Co.has bought most local farms. The{machinery has changed his life-style because it has made life easier for him and his wife. They used to milk cows by hand before going to school and when they came back. 32 years ago he went by pony and trap to market but these days he goes by car. The{size}of the farm used to be 45 acres but now they have 90 acres as they have bought more land from other farmers.When they came they {grew}sugar beet, barley,grass and corn but this year they have only grass. They had dairy cattle but since 1978 they've only had beef cattle as this means less work and the E.E.C.pay a subsidy.
